title: random Fps drop need fix ASAP
body: So when i start a game my fps is around 60 - 40 fps but in the middle of the game at random moments it drops too 22-5 fps and stays there for a couple mins then jumps back can someone plz help me figure out my problem

replies.body:
Hey Thatmanzay.

It looks like your graphics card isn't being properly detected by the game. Following these steps should help you resolve this FPS problem!

1) Make Sure you are running the game as an Administrator. You can do that by following these steps:
- Right-Click on the League Launcher
- Select the properties tab
- Check the box labeled "Run as administrator"

2) Verify you have the most up to date graphics drivers installed. You can find links to the three major GPU manufacturers here:

- [AMD Graphics Cards](http://support.amd.com/us/gpudownload/Pages/index.aspx )
- [NVidia Graphics Cards](http://www.nvidia.com/Download/index.aspx?lang=en-us)
- [Intel Graphics Cards](https://downloadcenter.intel.com/default.aspx)

3) Delete your Game.cfg file. This can sometimes be corrupt and deleting the file will reset your settings to default, it's located on your computer here:

Your install Location (Usually C:\) > Riot Games > League of Legends > Config > Game.cfg

Please let me know if this works out!
Does running the game as administrator has any effect? O.o

If files get locked or have their permissions changed so only administrators can run them, it can cause strange problems. Running League of Legends as administrator will allow it to ignore permissions and run the files anyways. If you aren't having any problems, you shouldn't need to do it, but it is a good step to try before doing anything major on your computer.

I had this problem a while ago, couldn't figure out what was happening. But I noticed my CPU temps would rise coinciding with the FPS drops. My heat sink had come unglued. That fixed mine. May not be your problem, but it was something that I hadn't thought of when exploring drivers and whatnot.
